Pre-Game Insights: England and Scotland's sporting rivalry began in 1870 with unofficial football contests.
This is the first T20 meeting between England and Scotland.
England are defending a global title in this T20 World Cup.
Jos Buttler's T20 outfit looks fit and firing despite a frustrating experience during their warm-up series against Pakistan.
Jofra Archer's successful return from injury gives depth and edge to England's attack.
Scotland romped into the 2024 event with six wins out of six in the regional qualifiers in Edinburgh.
England's T20 World Cup record against European nations makes for inspirational reading for Scotland.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match ended with no result due to rain.
The strip in Barbados is the same that was used for Namibia's low-scoring thriller against Oman.
England's rain-affected home series with Pakistan meant they were forced to compromise their intended preparations.
England have never yet beaten a European nation at the T20 World Cup.
Moeen Ali needs two more wickets to reach 50 in T20Is.
Buttler became England's most-capped player and first man to score 3000 runs in T20Is during the series against Pakistan.
Others: Jos Buttler, England's captain, emphasized the importance of focusing on the Scotland match.
Matthew Cross of Scotland highlighted the excitement of playing England at a World Cup.
